ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Obscure auditory dysfunction
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reports significant difficulty comprehending speech in noise despite completely normal peripheral hearing sensitivity and normal retrocochlear function.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Normal hearing
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: All audiometric tests (pure tone, speech, tympanometry, reflexes, ABR, OAEs) are within normal limits, ruling out peripheral pathology.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess peripheral hearing sensitivity across the frequency range.
To assess speech recognition threshold and clarity in quiet.
To assess the integrity of the reflex arc and retrocochlear pathways.
To evaluate retrocochlear function and rule out neural pathology.
To confirm normal cochlear outer hair cell function.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates completely normal peripheral hearing sensitivity, excellent speech recognition in quiet, and normal middle ear and retrocochlear function. There is no evidence of peripheral pathology to explain the reported difficulty in noise, consistent with obscure auditory dysfunction.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing sensitivity bilaterally; thresholds 0-10 dB HL across 250-8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 0 dB HL (Right), 5 dB HL (Left); SRS 96% (Right), 100% (Left).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms bilaterally; static compliance 0.35 cc (Right), 1.15 cc (Left).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present at normal levels (90-95 dB HL ipsilateral and contralateral).

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: All waves normal; interpeak latencies and latency-intensity functions normal.

proposed_items: Employment of select assistive listening devices
counseling_actions: Discuss normal test findings and explain that the ears are detecting sound perfectly
Validate the reality of the difficulties in social contexts despite normal results
Explain possible underlying causes such as anxiety or mild auditory processing problems (Obscure Auditory Dysfunction)

escalation.destination: Specialist for further evaluation (e.g., Auditory Processing Disorder)
escalation.rationale_short: Referral is offered if the patient desires to investigate potential etiologies like APD, as peripheral pathology has been ruled out.

follow_up_plan.objective: Re-evaluation, or sooner if additional symptoms develop.
